body.p: Macrophages are nonspecific phagocytic cells. This means:

multiple_choice.choice: They can engulf any invader they recognize as foreign.
They can only engulf one type of bacteria.

response.feedback: Correct. Yes, they are important nonspecific immune cells that will try to engulf anything they recognize as foreign.
Incorrect. Secreting antibodies is the job of certain lymphocytes in the specific immune system.
Incorrect. Macrophages are a mature cell form. They are a mature form of monocytes.
Incorrect. If they could only engulf one type of cell, that would indicate that they were specific; macrophages are nonspecific cells.

part.hint: Macrophages are part of the nonspecific immune system.
